decks.name: HTTP & TCP
decks.description: Part one of internet fundamentals and functionality

decks.name: Back-End HTTP Status Codes
decks.description: A collection of status code questions

cards.front: What is the responsibility of HTTP?
cards.back: To structure requests and responses over the internet. HTTP requires data to be transferred from one point to another over the network.

Transmission Control Protocol manages the channels between your browser and the server. It manages many types of internet connections in which one computer or device wants to send something to another.

cards.front: What is HTTP in relation to TCP?
cards.back: Hypertext Transfer Protocol is the command language that the devices on both sides of the Transmission Control Protocol must follow in order to communicate.
The technology required to process the incoming requests, generate responses, and send them back to the client.
A computational system that listens for incoming requests.

cards.front: What does an HTTP status code of 1xx represent?
cards.back: Informational. A request has been received, continuing to process.

cards.front: What does an HTTP status code of 2xx represent?
cards.back: Success. The action requested by the client has been received, understood, and accepted.

cards.front: What does an HTTP status code of 3xx represent?
cards.back: Redirection. The client must take additional action to complete the request.

cards.front: What does an HTTP status code of 4xx represent?
cards.back: Client Error. The server should include an entity containing an explanation of the error situation, and whether it is a temporary or permanent condition.

cards.front: What does an HTTP status code of 5xx represent?
cards.back: Server Error. The server failed to fulfill an apparently valid request.
